intro: Tarphochlamys affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tarphochlamys, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically purple or violet in color, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests.
